title: When is Star Wars: The Rise Of Skywalker released and who is in it?
text:
We don’t have long to wait until Star Wars episode 9 is here (Picture: AP)

Star Wars fans have been left waiting in anticipation for the next trailer for the forthcoming Rise Of Skywalker, following rumours that it would be debuting this week.

Cast member John Boyega was also left in the dark after his agent, Femi Oguns, claimed on social media it would air on US screens during Monday Night Football – and got everybody all worked up.

‘I don’t know when the trailer is coming out…I definitely think it’s soon though!’ Boyega said in response to fans desperate for news.

In fact it’s not very long until the actual film opens either – but when do we get to see that?

Here’s what you need to know…

When is Star Wars Episode 9: The Rise Of Skywalker released?

Star Wars Episode 9: The Rise Of Skywalker is released in the UK on Thursday 19 December.

Advertisement

Advertisement

There’s no word yet on how many screens it will be released on, but given this is Star Wars we’re expecting it’ll be on pretty much everywhere.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

While the new trailer might be imminent, Disney released a two-minute trailer for the film back in the summer which plays like a trip down memory lane.

The clip runs through the Star Wars series, featuring all the classic characters – including the late Carrie Fisher as Princess Leia – before bringing us bang up to date with new footage.

It was the clip of Daisy Ridley’s character Rey which has left fans guessing however – with the trailer featuring her in a dark hood and brandishing a red double lightsabre similar to that used by Darth Maul, suggesting she may be heading to the dark side.

Who is in the cast of Star Wars Episode 9: The Rise Of Skywalker?

The trailer has no shortage of familiar faces (Picture: Disney)

The film sees a bunch of familiar faces returning to the franchise, with Oscar Isaac, Lupita Nyong’o, Domnhall Gleeson, Kelly Marie Tran and Adam Driver all returning alongside Boyega and Ridley.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Carrie Fisher will also appear – with the blessing of her daughter Billie Lourd, who is also in the film – with the late actress being featured in previously unused footage which was filmed for seventh instalment The Force Awakens.

Among those joining the cast this time are Naomi Ackie, Keri Russell, Richard E Grant and Dominic Monaghan.

What happens in The Rise Of Skywalker?

Well it’s the final film in the Star Wars saga, meaning you can expect all those loose ends to be tied up – but the synopsis tells us this: Lucasfilm and director J.J. Abrams join forces once again to take viewers on an epic journey to a galaxy far, far away with Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker, the riveting conclusion of the seminal Skywalker saga, where new legends will be born and the final battle for freedom is yet to come.’

Which doesn’t really give anything away at all, but we’ll know soon enough what happens as the release date draws closer…

description: Star Wars' ninth instalment The Rise Of Skywalker is due on screens very soon - here's what you need to know about the film.
